details.title: Key contestants
details.content:
BJP

Vasundhara Raje (Jhalrapatan, pitted against the Congress's Manvendra Singh, son of Jaswant Singh)

Congress

Sachin Pilot (Tonk, contesting against Yunus Khan, the only Muslim candidate from the BJP)

Ashok Gehlot (Sardarpura)

details.title: What did the exit poll predict for Rajasthan?
details.content:
CVoter - Republic TV: Congress (129-145), BJP (52-68)
CNX - Times Now: Congress (105), BJP (85)
India TV: Congress (100-110), BJP (80-90)
CSDS - ABP: Congress (101), BJP (83)
Axis My India - India Today and Aaj Tak: Congress (119-141), BJP (55-72)

details.title: Current trends: 186 /199
details.content:
• BJP 74
  • Congress 96
  • BSP 1
  • Others 15

• Rajasthan's Health Minister Kalicharan trailing by 117 votes in Malviya Nagar seat.
  • Congress candidate and former DGP Harish Meena trails by 1,779 votes in Deoli-Uniara seat of Rajasthan.
  • PCC president Sachin Pilot leading in Tonk seat with a margin of 2007 votes.
  • BJP candidate and Transport Minister Yoonus Khan trailing.
  • Congress candidate and Commonwealth gold medallist Krishna Poonia leading in Rajasthan's Sadulpur constituency with a margin of 646 votes in first round of counting.

• Rajasthan Assembly Speaker Kailash Meghwal leads by 3,411 votes in Bhilwara's Shahpura seat.
  •  
  • Cong candidate and Commonwealth gold medallist Krishna Poonia leading in Rajasthan's Sadulpur constituency with a margin of 646 votes in first round of counting.
  •  
  • Rajasthan's Social Justice Minister Arun Chaturvedi trailing by a margin of 2,467 votes in the civil lines constituency in Jaipur.
  •  
  • Rajasthan's UDH Minister Srichand Kriplani trails by 321 votes in Nimahera constituency.
  •  
  • Rajasthan's Agriculture Minister Prabhu Lal Saini trailing by 1,167 votes in the Anta seat.
  •  
  • Rajasthan Water Resource Minister Rampratap trailing by margin of 658 votes in Hanumangarh seat.

details.title: Congress will form the next government in Rajasthan, says a confident Ashok Gehlot
details.content: AICC general secretary and former Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot watching the results of Assembly polls at his home in Jaiput. (Photo | Special arrangement)
CM Vasundhra Raje reaches BJP office in Jaipur, asks media to wait.

Trends make it clear that Congress is forming Govt in Rajasthan with a full majority, we had 21 seats last time. We should wait for the final numbers. Congress leadership and MLAs will decide who will get what role, says State Congress chief Sachin Pilot.

details.title: Congress will form Govt in three states: Sachin Pilot
details.content:
Sachin Pilot,Congress: Rahul Gandhi became party president exactly a year ago this day, so this result is a gift for him. Congress will form Govt in three states #AssemblyElection2018 pic.twitter.com/WwDL5tgP0o

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018
BJP candidate Samram Grasiya wins from Pindwara Abu by 27000 votes.

details.title: First result in
details.content: BJP candidate Samaram Grasiya from Pindwara Abu constituency wins by 27000 votes
Congress' Jahida khan wins from Kaman by 45,000 votes.

Congress' Sachin Pilot in talks with eight independents in Rajasthan: ANI

"We are moving towards a full majority and I am sure it will be clear once final numbers are in, but still we welcome all like-minded and anti-BJP parties to support us and we are in touch," says Sachin Pilot.
BJP's Col Sona Ram Choudhary loses to Congress' Mewaram Jain in Barmer constituency.
Vasundhra Raje leading by 18000 votes.
Congress President Rahul Gandhi reaches Sonia Gandhi's residence, 10 Janpath, reports ANI.
Congress President Rahul Gandhi reaches Sonia Gandhi's residence, 10 Janpath, reports ANI.

Independents are leading in 14 constituencies.

Former CM Ashok Gehlot says Congress' door is open to all.

• Congress rebel Dudu Babulal Nagar is leading
  • In Gangapur, Congress' Ramkesh is leading against BJP's Mansingh Gurjar
  • Ramila Kahdiya leading against BJP's Bhima Bai by 5000 vote
  • Independent candidate Phalodi Kumbh Singh is leading against BJP's Pabba Ram
A para-military jawan guards EVMs at a counting centre in Jaipur Tuesday. (Photo | PTI)
In Behror, Ganganagar and Khandela, fight is between Independents and Congress candidates, reports TNIE correspondent Rajesh Asnani.
Congress' Vishvendra Singh wins from Deeg-Kumher.
Ashok Gehlot wins from Sardarpura, Sachin Pilot from Tonk.

Sanjay Kakade, BJP Rajya Sabha MP: I knew we would lose in Rajasthan & Chhattisgarh but MP trends have come as a surprise. I think we forgot the issue of development that Modi took up in 2014. Ram Mandir, statues & name changing became the focus. #AssemblyElectionResults2018 pic.twitter.com/pHXe4PwhPr

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018
Former Rajasthan chief minister Ashok Gehlot serves tea to the Congress party workers and guests while celebrating Rajasthan Assembly election results at his residence in Jaipur. (Photo | PTI)

This is the semi-final of the final match as 2019 elections will be held in next 2-3 months. For 2019 final match game is clear, now we are just waiting for the elections.The countdown for 2019 has begun.This is the beginning of the end, says West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee: ANI

टोंक में मुझे ऐतिहासिक बहुमत से जिताने के लिए जनता का तहेदिल से शुक्रिया। हम सब मिलकर टोंक और राजस्थान का कायाकल्प कर एक विकसित प्रदेश की नींव रखेंगे जिसमें समाज के हर वर्ग की उन्नति होगी। @INCIndia

— Sachin Pilot (@SachinPilot) December 11, 2018

details.title: Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje wins in Jhalarapatan seat
details.content: Raje wins by 34,980 votes, defeating Congress's Manvendra Singh in Jhalarapatan seat. (File photo | PTI)

आज भारत जीत गया और अहंकार हार गया। राजस्थान की जीत का श्रेय वहां की शांति प्रिय जनता और कांग्रेस कार्यकर्ताओं की कड़ी मेहनत को जाता है। कांग्रेस पार्टी आपकी उम्मीदों पर खरा उतरेगी।#CongressWinsBIG pic.twitter.com/dNJ0X1Bf7R

details.title: Sachin Pilot Profile
details.content:
In 2013, when the Congress faced its worst defeat, winning just 21 seats against the BJP's 163, party president Rahul Gandhi handed the reins of the state to the next gen leader, a two-time parliamentarian and son of former leader Rajesh Pilot who died in 2000 in a road accident in Dausa. 

[READ FULL STORY]

details.title: Congress leading in 98 seats
details.content: Source: Election Commission of India

These results will reinforce our fight against the fascist BJP regime and help in strengthening the grand alliance.#Results2018

Congress President Rahul Gandhi to brief media shortly.
I congratulate the people and Congress workers: Rahul Gandhi
It is a big responsiblity of Congress now: Party president Rahul Gandhi

The intentions of making India 'Congress-free','opposition-free' shows the arrogance of BJP. The people have made this nation 'arrogance-free' by voting out BJP.

Atleast now, the BJP should put some efforts to make this nation 'problem-free' and stop the unwanted 'travel-spree'.

— H D Devegowda (@H_D_Devegowda) December 11, 2018
It is the victory of the youth, the farmers and small-scale traders. It's a time for change: Rahul Gandhi
We will give these states (Rajasthan and Chhattisgarh) a vision and a government they can be proud of: Rahul Gandhi

As many as 13 of 19 ministers in the outgoing Vasundhara Raje government have lost the Assembly elections in Rajasthan as results and trends brought electoral reverses for the ruling BJP.

Outgoing Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje in Jaipur: I would like to congratulate Congress. I accept this mandate by the people. BJP has worked a lot for them in these 5 years, I hope the next party takes those policies and works forward. #AssemblyElectionResults2018 pic.twitter.com/yaPxTzgAPN

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018
